description: group of people seated outdoors; four men and right lying down, reclining and sitting--two with rifles; woman at center wearing large hoop earrings and a flowered blouse, with a child leaning against her; old woman at left with a standing toddler; four dogs
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date, Inscription and Edition

LRC, in pencil: [L.16 / FL (?)]; see Marks
markings: LLC, in pencil: [2e etat d\'une planche detruite (epreuve d\'essai) 7 Juin 1878]
provenance: [James A. Bergquist, Boston, Mass., until 1995; sold in August for AOO, to Harry Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (1995-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LLC, in the print: [G Dore]; LLC, in pencil: [Contrebandiers espagnols]; see Marks
title: Contrebandiers espagnols (Spanish Smugglers)
